item.title: Cans and bottles dropped in alleyway, 19th November
item.description:
For the last month there have been cans and bottles and other rubbish dropped along the path between the station carpark and Sidcup road .The bin was removed so there is nowhere for rubbish yo go
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sidcup Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving Barrier is broken, 19th November
item.description:
The paving stones have been decaying for several years and have been patched unsuccessfully. The mud is slowly spilling out onto the road. It is becoming a public danger and will block peoples exits.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Road, Blendon, Sidcup, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: NW6 6BG in front of nos 1 to 101 Hartland Rd, 19th November
item.description:
As can be seen on pictures, loads of wet leaves everywhere i.e.on pavements and gutters, under cars and so on... We have to walk on street as it is so treacherous. Would you please kindly sweep ASAP. Thank you for your understanding and clearing of leaves.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bins full, 19th November
item.description:
Could the bins be emptied please, litter behind bins as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cocksure Lane, North Cray, Foots Cray, London Borough of Bexley

item.title: Scattered potholes on the highway, 19th November
item.description:
There has been a worsening pothole in this location for 4 + years. The council has recently been back and double yellow lined the road, but the actual surface hasn't been touched. For Lidl this is now causing issues with loading and unloading, with a driver injured due to a trip.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brindley Way, Sundridge, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faded road markings, 19th November
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing and double yellow lines outside Tesco are very faded. Loads of cars park up on the double yellow lines meaning buses can't get through the traffic lights easily as there is no space to pass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croxted Road, Dulwich, London Borough of Southwark

item.title: At the corner of Honiton Rd NW6 6QD and Hartland NW6 6BG, 19th November
item.description:
Lots of wet leaves on double yellow and in street gutters preventing proper rainwater drainage and causing a puddle. Would you please kindly sweep / remove those leaves that are turning into compost as those are accumulated leaves and not from recent leaf fall. It would be much appreciated, thanks.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Honiton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
